main event: A bright, reddish-orange object was spotted in the sky over Corvallis, Oregon on March 9, 1967.
interesting points: The object initially appeared as a single round object, then split into two objects.
The object was described as being the size of a satellite and moving rapidly downward before burning out above the horizon.
Multiple observers reported seeing the object, which was visible for about 2-4 minutes.
Weather conditions were clear and calm at the time of the sighting.
No definitive explanation for the sighting was provided, though the report suggested it may have been a balloon or other atmospheric phenomenon.
sighted object: a bright, reddish-orange object that split into two
